results.name: If n (in base 10) is d_1 d_2 ... d_k then a(n) = Sum_{i = 1..[k/2] } |d_i - d_{k-i+1}|.
comment: Might be called the Palindromic Deviation (or PD(n)) of n, since it measures how far n is from being a palindrome. - _W. W. Kokko_, Mar 13 2013
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Index entries for sequences related to palindromes
mathematica: f[n_] := (k = IntegerDigits[n]; l = Length[k]; Sum[ Abs[ k[[i]] - k[[l - i + 1]]], {i, 1, Floor[l/2] } ] ); Table[ f[n], {n, 0, 100} ]
